page.title: 01REVIEW:HUNTON AND HAUXWELL
page.content: The{villages of Hunton and Hauxwell, both recorded in the original Domesday Book, lie within this area.{Hauxwell {Pop.56}nestles on a hillside above the wooded parkland of Hauxwell Hall, a private estate. Within its grounds is an interesting{Norman church.} {Hunton, Pop.311,}is in the valley to the south east. It has a combined Post Office and shop, a Primary School, the church and chapel, a village hall, two inns,a dairy and a repair garage.A bus service operates on Fridays only to Leyburn. Narrow roads lead also to the market towns of Bedale and Richmond. Pleasant rolling farmland, mostly pasture, surrounds both villages and isolated dwellings. All the fields are divided by neat hedgerows interspersed with trees. Two becks meander across the area. An army training ground lies north of Hauxwell Lane.
